text.p: These are some of the leading stories in the official Vietnamese press on Thursday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
-- An Israeli communications delegation headed by Communications Minister Limor Livnat arrives in Hanoi on Thursday for a five-day visit.
-- International credit card use in Vietnam is growing. Payments by card amounted to $160-$170 million last year.
-- Forest rangers will be authorised to carry weapons supplied by the Ministry of Defence.
-- Vietnam will spend 2,300 billion dong ($197.1 million) for a national sports programme including training, construction of sports facilities and equipment.
-- Electricity shortages will threaten Vietnam later this month when hydro-electric power plants have no water to run at capacity.

-- The British Ambassador to Vietnam David Fall, held a reception in Hanoi on Wednesday on the occasion of the birthday of Queen Elisabeth II. Trade Minister Le Van Triet and Vice Foreign Minister Nguyen Dy Nien were present.
-- 141 people have been officially listed by the Central Committee of the Fatherland Front as candidates for National Assembly elections next month.
